content: Cite examples from August Schleicher's "Stammbaumtheorie" to illustrate his view on this: August Schleicher was a 19th-century German linguist who contributed to the study of word meanings through his work on historical and comparative linguistics. He developed the idea of language families, proposing that languages evolve over time through a process of change and divergence, similar to the evolution of species in biology. Schleicher's work helped to establish the field of historical linguistics and showed how the meanings of words can change over time as languages evolve.
